title: Episode 190: What the Supreme Court Got Right
itunes:title: Episode 190: What the Supreme Court Got Right
description:
We devote plenty of time to discussing things that the government does wrong. This week, we change gears as Clark Neily joins us to discuss things throughout history that the Supreme Court has done right.

Get Your Copy of Cooperation and Coercion Now!

http://www.cooperationandcoercion.com

Show Your Support for Words & Numbers at Patreon

https://www.patreon.com/wordsandnumbers

Quick Hits

Deaths by Car and SUV

https://www.iihs.org/topics/fatality-statistics/detail/passenger-vehicle-occupants

https://newsroom.aaa.com/tag/driving-cost-per-mile/

Term Limits for the Supremes?

https://www.breitbart.com/politics/2020/09/25/democrats-introduce-bill-to-democratize-supreme-court-limit-terms-to-18-years/

Rationing

https://www.msn.com/en-us/foodanddrink/other/uk-supermarkets-tesco-and-morrisons-are-rationing-toilet-paper-and-hand-sanitizer-as-fears-of-panic-buying-return-one-worker-said-their-store-was-worse-than-a-bad-christmas/ar-BB19pTBr

Foolishness of the Week

Time Travelling Professor

https://www.law.cornell.edu/constitution/articleiii

Topic of the Week: The Supreme Court's History
